author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Valparai police arrested M. Mahendran (27) from Dharapuram in Tirupur district on Saturday for allegedly attempting to murder a woman in a private school where she was working as an office assistant, in Valparai.

The incident created a flutter as it took place in the presence of hundreds of students and their parents who had come there to pick them up. According to the police, J. Stella Mary (33) was married to Joseph about 17 years ago. After his demise three years ago, she lived with her children aged 16 and 13 years.

It is learnt that Mahendran came to Valparai to work about eight years ago. He became close to the victim about two years ago. Inquiries revealed that Mary asked him to quit the job and go back to Tirupur, and that she would also join him soon.

After Mahendran’s return to Tirupur two months ago, she started avoiding him and this left him frustrated. Around 3 p.m. on Saturday, he came to the school and started assaulting her with a sickle in front of the head mistress’s office.

Mary suffered cuts on her face, head and back and also lost two fingers on her right hand when she tried to protect herself. She was rushed to the Valparai Government Hospital and referred to a private hospital, in Coimbatore. The police said that her condition was stable.

A case was registered against Mahendran under Section 307 (attempt to murder) of the Indian Penal Code. He was secured the same day. After inquiries, he was remanded on Sunday.
title: Attempt to murder woman at school
